Trumpism: A political phenomenon that defies all definition
description: Techno-libertarian, isolationist fascist, plutocratic populist? The politics of the 47th US president are impossible to pin down. While some compare his approach to certain European regimes, others argue it should be understood strictly within an American context – even if that means inventing a new term.

ChatGPT: OpenAI launches GPT-5, the latest version of its language processing tool
description: GPT-5, the new AI model available to all users of the popular chatbot, aims to be faster, more reliable and more accurate than its predecessor.

headline: On an Indonesian island, traces of human presence over one million years old have been discovered
description: Seven stone tools found on the island of Sulawesi are challenging current knowledge about the colonization of Asia by the genus 'Homo.' This landmass could only have been populated after a sea crossing, whether intentional or accidental. Many mysteries remain.

headline: The advantage of tiny lemurs as research subjects
description: An international team has dissected four gray mouse lemurs and has created an atlas of their cells. Certain similarities with human cells could prove useful for biomedical research.

headline: 'Here, you can dress however you want': Women-only parties make crowds feel freer
description: 'Why Do We Party?' (2/6). A concept that has gained popularity since the #MeToo movement, women-only parties have spread throughout France, giving partygoers the chance to finally lower their guard and let loose.

How Lake Chad became neglected by international aid
description: 'Lake Chad's Troubled Waters' (3/4). After a surge of solidarity in response to the attacks by Boko Haram, global attention has shifted away from the region. As NGOs have been weakened by the halt in US funding, the humanitarian situation remains dire.

headline: Wildfires blaze in southern France: 'It looked like the apocalypse'
description: In the Corbières hills, 16,000 hectares went up in flames in just 24 hours, despite 2,500 firefighters and the mobilization of nearly all of France's aerial resources.

headline: Mojgan Habibi, chef: 'Before, I was afraid of everything. Now, I have found my freedom'
description: 'Refuge Recipes' (4/6). Iranian native Mojgan Habibi is the breakfast chef at Hôtel du Couvent in Nice. Khoresht mast, a dish reserved for special occasions and made with yogurt, spices, honey and meat, brings back memories of her happy youth in Isfahan before her marriage, when she was free to create and sing.
